title: Snoop Dogg's son, former UCLA commit, explains why he quit football
text:
Snoop Dogg's son, former UCLA commit, explains why he quit football 
Snoop Dogg's son explains why he quit football. Stephen R. Sylvanie-USA TODAY Sports Oct 21, 2015 at 1:36p ET 0Shares Cordell Broadus was committed to play football for UCLA. If his name sounds familiar, perhaps it's because the former receiver is rapper Snoop Dogg's son. true A photo posted by CORDELL BROADUS (@cbroadus) on Oct 20, 2015 at 3:33pm PDT Broadus was a four-star recruit coming out of high school; he attended one of the elite high school football programs in the country. But after failing to show up to fall camp this offseason, it became clear that Broadus didn't have his heart in the game. UCLA head coach Jim Mora explained Broadus would "pursue other passions in his life" including film. In an Instagram post for his father's birthday, Broadus offered more details on why he left the UCLA program. I played football for my father because I thought that was the only way he would love me & be apart of my life. It took me 12 years to realize he loves Cordell Broadus the person not Cordell Broadus the football player. 
The best day of my life was when I heard those exact words; I love you dad hope you have a great birthday MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our College Football newsletters. 0
